author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court has upheld the decision of the Tamil Nadu Uniformed Services Recruitment Board to reject the candidature of a Sub Inspector aspirant who failed to submit the required certificates on time.

The candidate K. Amutha approached the court with a plea to direct the TNUSRB to add her name in the provisional sports quota list for the post of Sub Inspector of Police and permit her to undergo medical examination.

She had applied for the post and obtained certificates to prove her participation in a hockey tournament in 2014.

However, as the tournament was held five months prior to the TNUSRB job notification, her application was rejected by the Board. Challenging the decision the petitioner moved the court and submitted a certificate.

Assuming the certificate to be correct, the court directed the Board to allow her to participate in the recruitment.

But on verification, it transpired that the certificate was issued on March 21, 2014 and the petitioner had collected it only on August 5, 2015.
title: Recruitment Board’s ruling upheld
